note.p: Education: Harvard. BA (1690). Boston; Middle Temple (admitted 1697)

Career: Called to the Bar (1700); Attorney-General of the Province of Massachusetts Bay (1702); Advocate in the Vice-Admiralty court at Boston (1702); Judge of the Superior Court of Judicature (1718); Chief Justice of Massachusetts (1745-death)
Notes: Proposed by Sir Hans Sloane; John Chamberlayne
